CatDescriptText: Miss Rose Anderson, 7711 Bennett Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" answer reads: "Sometimes it helps, and other times it hinders. In some cases the aid causes trouble because the givers want to tell you what to do with it.  Generally, I would say that a young married should not receive aid.  Let them get out and do for themselves and learn to do it the hard way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rose Anderson, wearing dark coat with Persian lamb collar, studded hat, and dark leather gloves, posed in front of store windows, one on left with sign inscribed "Can you pick tomorrow's winners? Dow-Jones Industrial Stocks...1897, 1946, 1928, 1956", and one on right with display of eyeglasses
